cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI 

This paper deals with the problem of fair matching in kidney exchange, which involves designing algorithms to match patient-donor pairs in a way that is fair to all parties involved. This problem is closely related to the field of game theory (cs.GT), as it involves designing mechanisms that incentivize participants to behave in a certain way. The paper also proposes two algorithms for solving the matching problem, which involve using machine learning techniques (cs.AI) and data structures (cs.DS) to efficiently search for optimal solutions. Additionally, the paper discusses the tradeoff between different fairness criteria, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of statistical learning (cs.LG) and social choice theory (cs.SI). Overall, these factors suggest that the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.LG, and cs.SI, in descending order of likelihood.
